Package com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice

The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform network search service provides clients with the ability to perform network searches of various types against the latest versions of data, and to retrieve scored search results.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
INetworkSearchService A set of methods for performing network searches.
 

Class Summary
DataSizeException.Fault Contains information about the enclosing DataSizeException.
NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException.Fault Contains information about the enclosing NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException.
NetworkSearchValidationException.Fault Contains information about the enclosing NetworkSearchValidationException.
NodeDataSizeException.Fault Contains information about the enclosing NodeDataSizeException.
NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException.Fault Contains information about the enclosing NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException.
NodeUsesTooLargeSetException.Fault Contains information about the enclosing NodeUsesTooLargeSetException.
 

Exception Summary
DataSizeException The exception raised when a network search request cannot be processed because it involves more data than the server allows.
NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException The exception raised when a network search operation finds more networks than the server allows.
NetworkSearchValidationException The exception raised when a validation error occurs during a network search operation.
NodeDataSizeException The exception raised when a network search request cannot be processed because one of the NetworkSearchNodes involves more data than the server allows.
NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException The exception raised when a node in a network search operation finds more results than the server allows.
NodeUsesTooLargeSetException The exception raised when a network search request cannot be processed because one of the NetworkSearchNodes references a set that is larger than the server allows.
 

Package com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice Description

The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform network search service provides clients with the ability to perform network searches of various types against the latest versions of data, and to retrieve scored search results.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.

For Intelligence Analysis Platform clients, running a network search is usually a two-part operation:

  1. The client specifies the shape of the network to search for, along with optional conditions that apply to each node in the network. In response, the network search service returns a results summary containing the number of matching items and their associated types.
  2. The client specifies an identifier for the just-executed search, and the number and types of results that it wants to retrieve. The network search service then returns actual item results to the client, including an indication of how well each item matches the original search criteria. Highlighting information is not present in these results.
This approach is reflected in the web methods that the network search service makes available for clients to call:

Web methodDescription
SearchExecutes a search for a network of items that match the supplied conditions, and returns a summary of the search results.
RetrieveRetrieves results containing items that were found by an earlier call to Search.
SearchAndRetrievePerforms a one-step search and retrieve operation, combining the functionality of Search and Retrieve into a single call.

The network search service implements the security rules of the Intelligence Analysis Platform in its index, so that the summary of results only contains information about items that the user who performed the search can access.

Since:
4.0
